fields.customfield_31560: PPC-120 - Closed, TH-1261 - Closed, SR-6379 - Closed
fields.customfield_11165: You might have seen a Warning alert Cerebro stats collector failed after upgrading NCC or an AOS / Prism Central release bundled with NCC 3.6.2. This alert is related to a check that incorrectly raised a warning even in cases where data replication was not configured. It has been corrected in NCC 3.6.3 to trigger an error status where appropriate.
fields.customfield_27779:
“Changing status to “Not Approved” means that you do not believe the invention should be filed as a patent application. Please select only one check box from the below listed check boxes appearing under "Reasons for Non-Approval" as the primary reason for non-approval while moving the ticket to “Not Approved” status. Selecting more than one check box would lead to discrepancy in the count of each of the check boxes as "Reasons for Non-Approval" for the “Not Approved” tickets displayed in the patent dashboard application.

Optionally, if you wish then you may insert substantive reasons in a tactful manner that is appreciative of the inventor’s creativity, effort, and willingness to participate in the patent program.

Please note that if the reasons for non-approval don’t appear in the below listed check boxes, then you may select “Other” after which a mandatory new comment box would appear named “Reasons for Not Approval”, wherein you have to provide substantive reasons for non-approval.
fields.customfield_27780:
Changing status to “Pending Legal Review” means that you either believe that the idea has POTENTIAL to become a commercially valuable patent, or that it is a close decision for you and that you think Legal also should consider the ticket. Your reasoning is important. Please explain.
Address the below factors in your comments: (1) Technical merits of the idea, and why the idea impresses you or has potential; (2) Commercial value of the idea to Nutanix and customers; and (3) How could copying of the idea be detected or strongly inferred?

fields.description:
"Cerebro stats collector failed" alert generated on UI do not show any proper possible cause and recommendation and says "null", Source Entity also do not show any details and also description says "Cerebro stats collector failed". 

 !Screen Shot 2018-10-10 at 3.15.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Remove this alert if this should not come on UI or modify alert with correct details.

Setup Details:

1. Source AZ 
IP or name: 10.136.71.46
 Prism Username: admin 
Prism Password: Nutanix.123
 SSH Password: nutanix/4u

2. Source PE
 IP or name: arsene-2
 Hypervisor: AHV 
Prism Username: admin 
Prism Password: Nutanix.123 
SSH Password: nutanix/4u

2. Remote AZ 
 IP or name: 10.136.71.48
Prism Username: admin 
Prism Password: Nutanix.123 
SSH Password: nutanix/4u

1. Remote PE 
 IP or name: arsene-3
Hypervisor: AHV 
Prism Username: admin
 Prism Password: Nutanix.123
 SSH Password: nutanix/4u

Build Details:
Prism Central build :
stargate version el7.3-opt-euphrates-5.10-stable-10323d78ec2a0c925e4a199faa33e51fdc570703
last-commit-date 2018-10-04 23:39:30 -0700
ncc-3.6.3-cerebro build:  3.6.3-e937a44b

Prism Element build :
stargate version el7.3-opt-euphrates-5.10-stable-10323d78ec2a0c925e4a199faa33e51fdc570703
last-commit-date 2018-10-04 23:39:30 -0700
ncc-3.6.3-cerebro build:  3.6.3-e937a44b
fields.summary: "Cerebro stats collector failed" alert looks odd on UI.
fields.customfield_25161: [~dhaval.parekh] The fix is not applicable to AOS, it's NCC specific. We don't need any changes for AOS.

comments.body: [~nikhitha.maheshwarap] The alerts and tasks text are generated by the components itself. It would be safe to directly assign such tickets to cerebro going ahead.

[~nikhitha.maheshwarap] Can you point me to the cluster where we saw this alert? We have to check ~/data/logs/health_server.log on all the nodes to see why this plugin failed.

There is only one reason why it could fail because it could not read/write stats from Counters DB.
[~mahesh.venkataramaia] This alert is generated on both the PCs 10.136.71.46 and 10.136.71.48 and the respective PEs. You can check the logs.
The plugin should return an error if it fails to read/write stats instead of returning cls.fail(). I am working on the fix.
Adding case 407063 to this ENG. Customer encountered this issue in the field after upgrading to AOS 5.9. Log bundle is incoming. Let me know if you need any other info!
I added case 405850 to this.  My customer is hitting this on every cluster upgraded to 5.9.  I've requested log bundles from the clusters.

Adding case 403340 to this. My customer is reporting the issue since the AOS upgrade to 5.9.

Logs are available on diamond

Data is located on the customer data repository, diamond in:
/users/manali.aundhekar/shared/403340/NCC-logs-2018-10-09-962684477740666392-1539077885

Seeing this in another customer case, 408689 we are seeing this same alert in Prism UI:
{noformat}
2018-10-16 20:19:20 ERROR counters_interface.py:40 [cerebro_stats_collector] cmd: python /home/nutanix/bin/counters_cli svm_ids failed with error:
2018-10-16 20:19:20 ERROR cerebro_stats_collector_checks.py:132 [cerebro_stats_collector] Exception: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/hudsonb/workspace/workspace/ncc_ncc_ncc-3.6.2-release-SGAAAIL3MPQ7QNRWNXUZH5C4UP5AAMVBGTOCMPSV5SF7YDT5I3WQ/ncc-3.6.2-release/builds/build-ncc-3.6.2-release-release/ncc-python-tree/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/ncc/plugins/health_checks/cerebro_stats_collector_checks.py", line 102, in cerebro_collect_stats_and_publish
  File "/home/hudsonb/workspace/workspace/ncc_ncc_ncc-3.6.2-release-SGAAAIL3MPQ7QNRWNXUZH5C4UP5AAMVBGTOCMPSV5SF7YDT5I3WQ/ncc-3.6.2-release/builds/build-ncc-3.6.2-release-release/ncc-python-tree/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/serviceability/resource_predict/resource_predict_lib/stats_store/stats_store.py", line 452, in auto_analysis
  File "/home/hudsonb/workspace/workspace/ncc_ncc_ncc-3.6.2-release-SGAAAIL3MPQ7QNRWNXUZH5C4UP5AAMVBGTOCMPSV5SF7YDT5I3WQ/ncc-3.6.2-release/builds/build-ncc-3.6.2-release-release/ncc-python-tree/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/serviceability/resource_predict/resource_predict_lib/analysis_factory/analysis_factory.py", line 98, in initialize
  File "/home/hudsonb/workspace/workspace/ncc_ncc_ncc-3.6.2-release-SGAAAIL3MPQ7QNRWNXUZH5C4UP5AAMVBGTOCMPSV5SF7YDT5I3WQ/ncc-3.6.2-release/builds/build-ncc-3.6.2-release-release/ncc-python-tree/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/serviceability/resource_predict/resource_predict_lib/stats_store/stats_store.py", line 379, in range_query
  File "/home/hudsonb/workspace/workspace/ncc_ncc_ncc-3.6.2-release-SGAAAIL3MPQ7QNRWNXUZH5C4UP5AAMVBGTOCMPSV5SF7YDT5I3WQ/ncc-3.6.2-release/builds/build-ncc-3.6.2-release-release/ncc-python-tree/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/serviceability/resource_predict/resource_predict_lib/stats_store/counters_interface.py", line 149, in read_range
  File "/home/hudsonb/workspace/workspace/ncc_ncc_ncc-3.6.2-release-SGAAAIL3MPQ7QNRWNXUZH5C4UP5AAMVBGTOCMPSV5SF7YDT5I3WQ/ncc-3.6.2-release/builds/build-ncc-3.6.2-release-release/ncc-python-tree/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/serviceability/resource_predict/resource_predict_lib/stats_store/counters_interface.py", line 109, in _get_counters_svm_ids
IOError: Reading svm ids from counters failed2018-10-16 20:19:21 ERROR ncc_task.py:500 [cerebro_stats_collector] Check run by plugin health_checks cerebro_stats cerebro_stats_collector failed
2018-10-16 20:19:21 INFO ncc_task.py:567 [cerebro_stats_collector] Status for plugin health_checks cerebro_stats cerebro_stats_collector is PASS {noformat}
Interesting that it also logs pass immediately after.
I am attaching this case to the JIRA. If more data is needed please request.

Thanks.

[~jeremy.jorgensen] This issue is happening because counters_cli is returning an error. This is an intermittent error. 

In the current code, we are raising the alert even if the plugin errors out, I have a patch to fix this issue. We should not raise the alert if the plugin errors out, it should only be raised if the NCC plugin fails. In this case, an alert should be raised only when the analysis of the stats shows that the current RPO is not supported.

  File "/home/hudsonb/workspace/workspace/ncc_ncc_ncc-3.6.2-release-SGAAAIL3MPQ7QNRWNXUZH5C4UP5AAMVBGTOCMPSV5SF7YDT5I3WQ/ncc-3.6.2-release/builds/build-ncc-3.6.2-release-release/ncc-python-tree/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/serviceability/resource_predict/resource_predict_lib/stats_store/counters_interface.py", line 178, in read_range
IOError: Read failed for the table name: curator_stats for the given range, start timestamp: 1539577658000000 end timestamp: 1539750458000000

[~nikhitha.maheshwarap] Please verify the fix. The NCC build is available in the following location:

http://mars.corp.nutanix.com/builds/ncc-builds/ncc-3.6.3-cerebro/14dd9dc69a90c79a53ce89967d1f87c966602a33/x86_64/

[~mahesh.venkataramaia] Verified on the build:
stargate version el7.3-opt-euphrates-5.10-stable-4736d9dcc8435424ea3d89dd5746589a024a44fc
         last-commit-date 2018-10-15 14:53:14 -0700

[~ben] [~blaise.cacciola] doesn't look like this bug got flagged to be in the Release Notes. I searched yesterday and couldn't find it. I would think a bug with a 140 cases linked would be?
Yes, looks like it should have been. [~monica.manghnani] please get this in the release notes ASAP.
[~robert.leonis] Our RN Jira filter won't find tickets where Affected and Fix Version are equal but many thanks for the head's up.
Thanks [~ben] [~blaise.cacciola]
Also - [~robert.leonis] this looks like an NCC fix so it'll also get into the NCC 3.6.3 RNs for sure as well.
Yes, forgot too mention I did also look in the NCC 3.6.3 RNs - thanks again
Thanks Blaise (y)

[~mahesh.venkataramaia] - This is an NCC fix. The integrated version shows AOS as well. Could we update the integrated version to just show the NCC builds that this fix is integrated in please ? I have cced Bharathi here. Its just that its confusing sometimes. :) 

cc: [~bharathi.maganti] [~sasthak.ramamur]

[~mahesh.venkataramaia] does this need to be a fix for AOS as well. Looks like just ncc however the integrated version shows AOS. 

If applicable to AOS please back port it to 5.10.7. Let us know Thanks.
[~dhaval.parekh] The fix is not applicable to AOS, it's NCC specific. We don't need any changes for AOS.

fields.customfield_27862: Once this ticket is closed, it cannot be edited, except comments section of the ticket
